column1: # Title:    Roman predicted thermal background spectrum for observation planning
# Pedigree:  This is the predicted self-emission thermal background spectrum
# for Roman for use in planning observations.  The data came from a model
# provided by David Hughes at GSFC
# primary mirror) from 5 primary components (e.g. optics).  The instrumental
# radiance at all wavelengths.  David's model rolls up many terms in the thermal
# and estimated view factors of various subcomponents.  For the purposes here
# some of these terms must be factored out before the individual subcomponents
# can be summed to provide the below spectrum. Russell has a jupyter-notebook
# describing the full conversion from David's file: HLS_F184_20200629.xlsx
# Columns:  wavelength (micron) and equivalent sky radiance (MJy/sr)
